newsitem.title: USA: N.Y.C. seen delaying October budget modification.
newsitem.headline: N.Y.C. seen delaying October budget modification.

text.p: New York City Mayor Rudolph Giuliani, who had been planning to finish a first budget adjustment around October 24, is running behind and might not complete the task until after the November 5, city sources said on Monday.
The reason for the delay was not immediately clear, but the sources, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said there did not appear to be any particular problem.
"It's just time-wise that seems to be where the wind is blowing," one city source said.
A spokeswoman for Mayor Giuliani was not immediately available to comment.
New York City, which reached a $33 billion budget pact for fiscal 1996-97 in late June, modifies its budget twice a year.
A city source added that in the offering documents for last week's sale of $1.6 billion of Revenue Anticipation Notes, the New York City indicated that it did not expect more than a small adjustment.
Another source speculated that the city might focus its efforts on laying the groundwork for long-term planning to help it reduce yawning budget gaps in future years.
